news_header: Maia Sandu declared victory in Moldova's presidential election with 54.5% of the votes, emphasizing freedom, truth, and justice.
news_text: Maia Sandu, the current president of Moldova, announced her victory in the presidential election, securing 54.5% of the votes against Aleksandr Senanoglo, who received 45.5%. Sandu highlighted the themes of freedom, truth, and justice in her victory speech. The election followed a first round where Sandu was the most popular candidate. Despite pressure from Russia, many Moldovans support EU membership, although opposition exists in rural areas and regions like Transnistria and Gagauzia. Analysts note that fears of conflict influence voter preferences.
